title: .finally()
description: The `.finally()` JS method adds a handler to be called when the promise is settled, regardless of its result and returns a new `Promise` object resolving with the same value or reason as the original promise.
content: The method that attaches a callback function to a promise, which will be executed when the promise is settled, regardless of whether it was fulfilled or rejected. Itâ€™s typically used for cleanup tasks.
